001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers;
002
003import java.util.Iterator;
004import java.util.Objects;
005import java.util.Spliterators;
006import java.util.function.Function;
007import java.util.stream.Stream;
008import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
009
010public interface Array<N> extends Iterable<N>, Cloneable {
011
012    N get(int index);
013
014    void set(int index, N value);
015
016    default void set(Array<N> values) {
017        set(values, 0, values.length());
018    }
019
020    default void set(Array<N> values, int offset) {
021        set(values, offset, values.length() - offset);
022    }
023
024    void set(Array<N> values, int offset, int length);
025
026    int length();
027
028    default Array<N> slice(int offset) {
029        return slice(offset, length() - offset, 1);
030    }
031
032    default Array<N> slice(int offset, int length) {
033        return slice(offset, length, 1);
034    }
035
036    Array<N> slice(int offset, int length, int stride);
037
038    Array<N> apply(Function<N, N> function);
039
040    N[] backingArray();
041
042    int offset();
043
044    int stride();
045
046    Array<N> clone();
047
048    class Impl<N> implements Array<N>, Cloneable {
049
050        private final N[] values;
051        private final int offset;
052        private final int length;
053        private final int stride;
054
055        public Impl(N[] values, int offset, int length, int stride) {
056            this.values = values;
057            this.offset = offset;
058            this.length = length;
059            this.stride = stride;
060        }
061
062        @Override
063        public N get(int index) {
064            return values[offset + index * stride];
065        }
066
067        @Override
068        public void set(int index, N value) {
069            values[offset + index * stride] = value;
070        }
071
072        @Override
073        public void set(Array<N> values, int offset, int length) {
074            for (int i = 0, j = offset; i < length; i++, j++) {
075                this.values[this.offset + j * this.stride] = values.get(i);
076            }
077        }
078
079        @Override
080        public int length() {
081            return length;
082        }
083
084        @Override
085        public Array<N> slice(int offset, int length, int stride) {
086            return new Impl<>(values, this.offset + offset * this.stride, length * this.stride, this.stride * stride);
087        }
088
089        @Override
090        public Array<N> apply(Function<N, N> function) {
091            int limit = offset + length * stride;
092            for (int i = offset; i < limit; i += stride) {
093                values[i] = function.apply(values[i]);
094            }
095            return this;
096        }
097
098        @Override
099        public N[] backingArray() {
100            return values;
101        }
102
103        @Override
104        public int offset() {
105            return offset;
106        }
107
108        @Override
109        public int stride() {
110            return stride;
111        }
112
113        @Override
114        public Impl<N> clone() {
115            return new Impl<>(values.clone(), offset, length, stride);
116        }
117
118        @Override
119        public Iterator<N> iterator() {
120            return new Iterator<>() {
121
122                private final int limit = offset + length * stride;
123                private int nextIndex = offset;
124
125                @Override
126                public boolean hasNext() {
127                    return nextIndex < limit;
128                }
129
130                @Override
131                public N next() {
132                    N value = values[nextIndex];
133                    nextIndex += stride;
134                    return value;
135                }
136            };
137        }
138
139        @Override
140        public String toString() {
141            return Array.toString(this);
142        }
143    }
144
145    static <N> Array<N> of(N[] values) {
146        return of(values, 0, values.length);
147    }
148
149    static <N> Array<N> of(N[] values, int offset) {
150        return of(values, offset, values.length);
151    }
152
153    static <N> Array<N> of(N[] values, int offset, int length) {
154        return new Array<>() {
155
156            @Override
157            public Iterator<N> iterator() {
158                return new Iterator<>() {
159
160                    private final int limit = offset + length;
161                    private int nextIndex = offset;
162
163                    @Override
164                    public boolean hasNext() {
165                        return nextIndex < limit;
166                    }
167
168                    @Override
169                    public N next() {
170                        N value = values[nextIndex];
171                        nextIndex++;
172                        return value;
173                    }
174                };
175            }
176
177            @Override
178            public N get(int index) {
179                return values[offset + index];
180            }
181
182            @Override
183            public void set(int index, N value) {
184                values[offset + index] = value;
185            }
186
187            @Override
188            public void set(Array<N> _values, int _offset, int _length) {
189                if (_values.stride() == 1) {
190                    System.arraycopy(_values.backingArray(), _values.offset(), values, offset + _offset, _length);
191                } else {
192                    for (int i = 0, j = offset; i < length; i++, j++) {
193                        values[j] = _values.get(i);
194                    }
195                }
196            }
197
198            @Override
199            public int length() {
200                return length;
201            }
202
203            @Override
204            public Array<N> slice(int offset, int length, int stride) {
205                return new Impl<>(values, offset, length, stride);
206            }
207
208            @Override
209            public Array<N> apply(Function<N, N> function) {
210                int limit = offset + length;
211                for (int i = offset; i < limit; i++) {
212                    values[i] = function.apply(values[i]);
213                }
214                return this;
215            }
216
217            @Override
218            public N[] backingArray() {
219                return values;
220            }
221
222            @Override
223            public int offset() {
224                return offset;
225            }
226
227            @Override
228            public int stride() {
229                return 1;
230            }
231
232            @Override
233            public Array<N> clone() {
234                return of(values.clone());
235            }
236
237            @Override
238            public String toString() {
239                return Array.toString(this);
240            }
241        };
242    }
243
244    static <N extends Number> Array<N> of(N[] values, int from, int length, int stride) {
245        return new Impl<>(values, from, length, stride);
246    }
247
248    static <N extends Number> int hashCode(Array<N> array) {
249        int result = 0;
250        for (N element : array) {
251            result += Objects.hashCode(element);
252        }
253        return result;
254    }
255
256    static <N extends Number> boolean equals(Array<N> array, Array<N> other, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
257        if (array.length() != other.length()) {
258            return false;
259        }
260        Iterator<N> thisIterator = other.iterator();
261        Iterator<N> otherIterator = array.iterator();
262        while (thisIterator.hasNext() && otherIterator.hasNext()) {
263            N thisValue = thisIterator.next();
264            N otherValue = otherIterator.next();
265            if (typeSupport.compare(thisValue, otherValue) != 0) {
266                return false;
267            }
268        }
269        return true;
270    }
271
272    static boolean equals(Array<?> array, Array<?> other) {
273        if (array.length() != other.length()) {
274            return false;
275        }
276        Iterator<?> thisIterator = other.iterator();
277        Iterator<?> otherIterator = array.iterator();
278        while (thisIterator.hasNext() && otherIterator.hasNext()) {
279            Object thisValue = thisIterator.next();
280            Object otherValue = otherIterator.next();
281            if (!thisValue.equals(otherValue)) {
282                return false;
283            }
284        }
285        return true;
286    }
287
288    static String toString(Array<?> array) {
289        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("[");
290        for (int i = 0; i < array.length(); i++) {
291            if (i > 0) {
292                sb.append(", ");
293            }
294            sb.append(array.get(i));
295        }
296        return sb.append("]@").append(Integer.toHexString(System.identityHashCode(array))).toString();
297    }
298
299    Array<?> EMPTY = empty();
300
301    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
302    static <N> Array<N> empty() {
303        return (Array<N>) EMPTY;
304    }
305
306    static <N> Stream<N> stream(Array<N> array) {
307        return StreamSupport.stream(
308                Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(array.iterator(), 0),
309                false
310        );
311    }
312}
